metadata.Title: CVE-2020-10802 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium
metadata.Description:
In phpMyAdmin 4.x before 4.9.5 and 5.x before 5.0.2, a SQL injectionvulnerability has been discovered where certain parameters are not properlyescaped when generating certain queries for search actions inlibraries/classes/Controllers/Table/TableSearchController.php. An attackercan generate a crafted database or table name. The attack can be performedif a user attempts certain search operations on the malicious database ortable.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-10802` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

phpmyadmin - 4:4.9.5+dfsg1-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: phpmyadmin package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4:4.9.5+dfsg1-1ubuntu1').
